data.prayer: Father, be a refuge and strength for the hurting in Tartus, Syria today.
data.verse: God is our refuge and strength, an ever-present help in trouble.

data.location_label: Photo from the state of Tartus, Syria
data.section_summary: What challenges do people here face?

data.prayer: Spirit, sanctify the 2,954 believers in Tartus and keep them blameless until Jesus returns.
data.verse: May the God of peace himself sanctify you completely. May your whole spirit, soul, and body be preserved blameless at the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ. He who calls you is faithful, who will also do it.

data.label_1: One disciple of Jesus for every 524 lost neighbors

data.prayer: Spirit, build the strength and maturity of the local leaders in Tartus, Syria. Show them that faithfulness is more important than knowledge. Show them that the Spirit, the Word, and prayer is enough in order to grow and lead.
Spirit, how will they hear without a preacher? How will they preach unless they have a Bible? Please give the people in the state of Tartus access to a Bible in their own language.
data.verse: How, then, can they call on the one they have not believed in? And how can they believe in the one of whom they have not heard? And how can they hear without someone preaching to them? And how can anyone preach unless they are sent? As it is written: “How beautiful are the feet of those who bring good news!”

data.prayer: Lord God, I thank you that the blood of Christ, who through the eternal Spirit offered himself without defect to God, can cleanse the Alawite people conscience from dead works to serve the living God.
God, guide the 2,954 believers in Tartus to multiply spiritual families that love you, love each other, and make disciples.
Lord, let it be said of the 1,547,046 lost in Tartus that you have called them out of darkness into your glorious light.
data.verse: But you are a chosen race, a royal priesthood, a holy nation, a people for God’s own possession, that you may proclaim the excellence of him who called you out of darkness into his marvelous light

data.prayer: Spirit, make the Word of God a delight to the people of Tartus, like it was to David.
data.verse: I delight in your decrees; I will not neglect your Word.
